instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3462: What is 820-3462? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MBPr - Dead SMC?
threads.message:
i only get green light if i use a fresh charger that has been used with a known working board before hand. if i unplug then replug i dont get green light.

corrosion next to SMC, <CAPACITOR>C6992</CAPACITOR> - 16v probably have shorted <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL>.

i then cleaned the corrosion, i haven't clean the SMC. no IPA went inside the SMC.

if reflow the SMC doesn't work then i will need to replace the SMC.


<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>: 12.27v - should be higher - so this indicator a dead SMC
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>: 3.4V

[IMG type="full" width="200px"]https://i.imgur.com/vRjWQOi.jpg[/IMG]

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MBPr - Dead SMC?
threads.message:
Is <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> high?

I would reflow the SMC first and see what happens, if <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is high. <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> has to be high for the SMC to turn on. Make sure to remove the edge bonding and don't let any get stuck under the chip.

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MBPr - Dead SMC?
[SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MBPr - Dead SMC?
threads.message:
this board was too easy, reflowed the SMC and it worked!

no other place has corrosion. 

passed all ASD... ok move on to next board.

cheers.
